name: Search podcasts by topic on Taddy to Airtable library

parameters.content:
## Search podcasts by topic on Taddy to Airtable library

## Who's it for
Podcast curators, researchers, and content strategists building searchable libraries of podcasts by topic, genre, or language.

## How it works
Enter a search keyword, genre, or language filter, and this workflow searches Taddy's database for matching podcasts. It retrieves full metadata including RSS feeds, episode counts, and descriptions, then saves everything to an Airtable base for easy organization and future reference.

## Requirements
- Taddy API account (free tier includes 2,000 requests/month, sign up at taddy.org)
- Airtable account with a base set up
- Self-hosted n8n instance (required for community nodes)

## How to set up
1. Install the Taddy community node from Settings > Community Nodes
2. Add your Taddy API credentials
3. Create an Airtable base with fields: Name (single line text), Description (long text), RSS URL (URL), Genre (single select), Language (single line text), Total Episodes (number)
4. Configure Airtable credentials in n8n
5. Update the Set Fields node with your search criteria
6. Run the workflow

## How to customize
- Add popularity filters or language restrictions
- Include latest episodes for each podcast
- Export to Google Sheets or Notion instead
- Schedule recurring searches to discover new podcasts
- Add filtering by episode count or publish frequency

Optional but recommended - gets full metadata
Adds: description, episode counts, genres, image URLs
Can also fetch latest episodes by toggling "includeEpisodes"

Creates new records in your base
Add deduplication logic if running multiple times
Tip: Add a "Date Added" field to track when discovered
Consider adding tags for categorization

Configure search criteria and execute

Set your search filters:
- keywords: e.g., "artificial intelligence", "true crime", "business"
- language: ISO codes like "en" (English), "es" (Spanish), "fr" (French)
- limit: max results to return (default: 25)

Searches Taddy's database of millions of podcasts
Uses pagination automatically if results exceed limit
Returns basic info: name, UUID, RSS URL
More filters available: popularity threshold, country, etc.
